The arbitration award shall be final and binding regardless of whether one of the parties fails or refuses to participate in the arbitration. The arbitrator shall not have the power to amend this Agreement in any respect.
18. ATTORNEYS' FEES. In the event of any dispute with respect to this Agreement, the prevailing party shall be entitled to reasonable attorneys' fees and other costs and expenses incurred in resolving such dispute.
19. TAXES. Unless otherwise agreed between Consultant and Company, Consultant and Company shall each have sole responsibility for collecting, reporting, and/or paying all income, sales, excise, property, value-added tax, and other taxes imposed by any governmental authority as they pertain to Consultant's and Company's respective duties, obligations, and performance hereunder.
20. DEFINITIONS.
As used herein, the terms set forth below shall have the following respective meanings:
20.1 "Documentation" means the publications prepared and delivered to Licensee by Pramati that accompanies the Software, such as reference, user, installation, systems administrator and technical guides.
20.2 "CPU" means each central processing unit designated for use on a specific computing device.
20.3 "Software" shall mean the machine readable object code, delivered by Pramati, to Licensee and may include software licensed from third parties, together with other software and/or other products subsequently delivered to Licensee by Pramati and all updates and upgrades of the same provided to Licensee by Pramati and/or its suppliers. 20.5 "Licensee" shall mean the entity or individual, either on the individual' s behalf or on behalf of the entity that individual represents, who installs the Software or otherwise agrees to be bound by the terms and conditions contained in this Agreement. Further, each individual representing an entity represents and warrants that he/she has the authority to bind the entity to this Agreement.
20.6 "Named Users" shall mean an individual or individuals employed by Licensee who is/are authorized to use the software. The number of licenses for the Program must equal the total number of Named Users.
20.7 "Application" shall mean machine-readable object code provided by "Application Provider" to Licensee which may be deployed on Software.
20.8 "Edition" shall mean either the Standard Edition or the Enterprise Edition of the Software. The Standard Edition does not allow use of certain features available in the Enterprise Edition.
